citation.article-title: Relationship of Bacillus subtilis clades associated with strains 168 and W23: a proposal for Bacillus subtilis subsp. subtilis subsp. nov. and Bacillus subtilis subsp. spizizenii subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Bacillus subtilis subsp. subtilis subsp. nov.
Bacillus subtilis subsp. subtilis (sub'ti.lis. L. adj. subtilis slender)
Motile rods, measuring 0.5 μm by 2.3 μm and occurring singly or in short chains.
Cylindrical spores are formed centrally or paracentrally in non-swollen sporangia.
Optimum growth temperature ranges from 28 to 30°C.
Grows in 7% (w/v) NaCl and at pH 5.6.
Growth in the presence of 0.001% (w/v) lysozyme is variable.
Produces acetylmethylcarbinol (Voges-Proskauer test); pH in Voges- Proskauer broth 5.5-5.7.
Hydrolyses starch and casein; tyrosine and phenylalanine are not decomposed.
Citrate is utilized; propionate is not utilized.
DGlucose, D-xylose, L-arabinose, mannitol and trehalose are fermented.
Ribitol is not a cell wall constituent.
Strains are not sexually isolated from strain 168.
The type strain, NRRL NRS-744T, is deposited at the ARS Culture Collection.
